cvEntries.description: As Tech Lead for robotics and control, I work to create robust and flexible architectures for our robotics systems. Together with a team of 5 extremely capable engineers, I lead the development of high and low level software, whilst maintaining the higher standards of coding practises
desc_items: Lead and mentored teams of up to 6 engineers
Created flexible architectures for robotics application using cutting edge framework such as AWS and ROS2
Developed outstanding code for the company stack in C++ and python
Championed good coding practices and setup CI/CD pipelines.
cvEntries.keywords: ROS2, Project Management, Algorithms, Artificial Intelligence (AI), Systems Engineering, Engineering, Agile Methodologies, Leadership, Team Leadership, Git, Computer Vision, Robot Operating System (ROS), Coding Practices

cvEntries.description: As Robotics Engineer, I work to create algorithms and analysis for our main product (EVA robot) to improve its reliability, safety, and precision. I propose new technical methodologies, drive projects for new features from start to completion, and tackle green-field projects by balancing exploration of new possibilities with business priorities. I maintain our outstanding codebase by daily contributing to code writing and reviewing.
desc_items: Mentored junior engineers in robotics, control, and programming practices
Owned projects from start to completion: state-of-the-art review -> selection -> implementation -> deployment in less than 1 month
Developed features requiring to bridge mathematical and engineering competencies e.g. shuttle planning and collision detection.
Reviewed and maintained legacy code abiding to back-compatibility policies
cvEntries.keywords: Planning, Data Analysis, Physics, Algorithms, Engineering, Leadership, Git, Robotics

cvEntries.description: As researcher engineer, I develop algorithms for controlling UAVs and UGVs using bio-inspired controllers. I have built the UAVs used in our testings from scratch. My team and I deployed successfully the system to the MBZIRC challenge, where our algorithms for controlling the robot were bridged with marker recognitions techniques using the onboard camera.
desc_items: Designed architectures for multiple UAVs coordination using ROS
Developed high-frequency vision algorithm capable to recognise specific shapes during the UAV motion
Implemented cutting-edge controller bio-inspired by the tau-theory to land on a moving target
Benchmarked and tested the hardware throughout the experimentation phase
Participated to an international robotics challenge at AbuDhabi with the TheBioRobotics lab team.
cvEntries.keywords: Engineering, Academic Background, Computer Vision, Drones, UAV, Control, C++, Robot Operating System (ROS)

cvEntries.description: As software firmware engineer, I have been responsible to optimise the firmware written in C of the two flagship product of the company. My optimisation improved the overall system speed of 100% and required a drastic change of the interfaces for coping with the increased throughput. However, the resulting increase in speed allowed more low-latency communication and utilisation of the devices by the user. In parallel to to my effort on the firmware side, I have been developing controller for multiple degrees of freedom arms.
desc_items: Utilised DMA for passing UART messages
Used control system like CLIK to control articulated arms
Developed ROS interfaces for our products
cvEntries.keywords: Engineering, Git, Optimization, Firmware, C++, Robotic Design, Robotics, Simulink, Robot Operating System (ROS)
